page.title: 07FULBOURN HOSPITAL
page.content: Fulbourn Hospital is the area hospital for the mentally ill; the neighbouring Ida Darwin Hospital is for mentally handicapped patients. We spoke to a nurse from the Drinks Problem Unit at Fulbourn Hospital, who said that the general aim is to rehabilitate the patients as soon as possible. The patients stay for varying lengths of time, usually on a voluntary basis, and undergo therapy and treatment as well as having different activities such as sports, entertainments and occasional outings. Patients can walk round, but not outside, the grounds. This is because of the temptation to have a drink, and also because of the danger to themselves if they are on drugs - though the policy is to minimse drug administration.
